intro: Helixanthera ligustrina, commonly known as the purple coneflower, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its showy, violet-blue flowers that bloom in the summer months. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. Its root system is fibrous, and it thrives in well-drained soils. Helixanthera ligustrina is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
